intro: Oxyanthus pulcher, commonly known as the beautiful oxyanthus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in shades of yellow and orange. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Oxyanthus pulcher thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
